message: what is the transfer policy for employee
response: The company may transfer employees to any department, division, or location in India or overseas at its discretion.  This applies to all full-time employees, for reasons including hiring, internal job postings, or new roles.  Employees will be subject to the practices, working hours, and holidays of their new location.  Intercompany transfers require the previous company to complete the exit process and the new company to complete onboarding.  Statutory benefits (PF, Leaves, Gratuity) will be transferred by the previous employer.  Intracompany transfers receive a transfer letter; intercompany transfers receive a new appointment letter.  The receiving company covers relocation costs for 7 days from the employee's departure from the previous location.  If an employee leaves after a transfer, a group service certificate will be issued.  Intra-company transfers will not receive experience certificates from previous units.  Employees should not lose gross emoluments due to a transfer, though the management may disallow reimbursements deemed unreasonable.  The management may amend the transfer policy at any time.  Employee-initiated transfers require notification to the supervisor and entity HR; fulfillment depends on vacancy and availability in the requested location; and may include an interview with the new location head.
